represents.label: Energy
represents.description: Boosts physical energy levels, increases heart rate and blood pressure, prompts adrenaline release

represents.label: Action
represents.description: Fast moving, promotes need for action and movement

represents.label: Desire
represents.description: Relates to physical desire in all its forms - sexual, appetite, cravings

represents.label: Passion
represents.description: Passionate belief in an issue or undertaking, including love or hate; anger is negative passion

effects.label: Stimulating
effects.description: Stimulates physical senses, sexual and physical appetite; triggers deeper passions such as sex, love, courage, hatred, revenge

effects.label: Exciting And Motivating
effects.description: Excites emotions and inspires action

effects.label: Attention Getting
effects.description: Demands notice, alerts to danger (e.g., red traffic lights and stop signs)

effects.label: Assertive And Aggressive
effects.description: Associated with assertiveness and aggression (e.g., drivers of red cars feeling aggressive)

variations.name: Maroon
description: A dark bluish red, denotes controlled and more thoughtful action
Softer than burgundy and less dramatic than true red

variations.name: Burgundy
description: A dark purplish red, more sophisticated and serious
Indicates controlled power, determined ambition, dignified action
Favored by the wealthy

variations.name: Crimson
description: Has a little blue
Indicates determination to succeed without upsetting others
Emits sensuality rather than sexuality

variations.name: Scarlet
description: Has a little orange, gives richness and brightness
Indicates enthusiasm and love of life
Less intense and more fun-loving than true red, tempered with defiance

represents.label: Adventure And Risk Taking
description: Orange promotes physical confidence and enthusiasm
Sportsmen and adventure-seekers relate well to orange

represents.label: Social Communication And Interaction
description: Orange stimulates two-way conversation between people
In a dining room when entertaining it stimulates conversation as well as appetite

represents.label: Friendship
description: Group socializing, parties, the community
Wherever people get together to have fun and socialize orange is a good choice

represents.label: Divorce
description: The optimism of the color orange helps people move on
It is forward thinking and outward thinking

effects.label: Enthusiasm
effects.description: Orange is optimistic and extroverted - the color of the uninhibited

effects.label: Rejuvenation
effects.description: Orange helps to restore balance to our physical energies

effects.label: Stimulation
effects.description: Orange is not as passionate or as excitable as red, but it is stimulating, particularly to the appetite - the worst color to have in the kitchen if you want to lose weight

effects.label: Courage
effects.description: Orange helps us to take account of our lives, to face the consequences, to take action and make appropriate changes, and then to move onward and upward

effects.label: Vitality
effects.description: Orange has a more balanced energy than red, not as passionate and aggressive, but full of vitality

variations.name: Peach
description: Peach encourages great communication and conversation
It inspires good manners and puts people at ease
It has all the attributes of orange but in a much softer, gentler and more cautious form

variations.name: Golden Orange
description: This version of orange encourages vitality and self-control

variations.name: Amber
description: Amber helps to inspire greater confidence and better self esteem
It can promote a degree of arrogance

variations.name: Burnt Orange
description: This color emits a negative vibration indicating pride, tension and aggressive self-assertion

variations.name: Dark Orange
description: Dark orange indicates over-confidence and over-ambition
It tries too hard to prove its worth and to boost its self-esteem, but when it fails, which is often, it develops a chip on its shoulder
It is the color of the opportunist, taking selfish advantage of every situation

represents.label: Mind And Intellect
represents.description: From a color psychology perspective, yellow stimulates our mental faculties; it activates the left or analytical brain

represents.label: Happiness And Fun
represents.description: Yellow is uplifting to the spirits; yellow helps create enthusiasm for life and can awaken greater confidence and optimism

represents.label: Communication Of New Ideas
represents.description: Yellow is related to the expression and integration of new ideas and thoughts

effects.label: Creative
effects.description: The color of new ideas, yellow helps us find new ways of doing things

effects.label: Quick Decisions
effects.description: Yellow helps with clear thinking and quick decision-making but it can also be impulsive

effects.label: Anxiety Producing
effects.description: Yellow is fast moving so too much time in its presence can agitate and lead to nervousness and emotional instability

effects.label: Critical
effects.description: Yellow makes people more mentally analytical and self critical of both themselves and others

effects.label: Non Emotional
effects.description: Yellow relates to the head not the heart

variations.name: Light Clear Yellow
description: This color helps to clear the mind
Making it open and alert

variations.name: Lemon Yellow
description: Lemon yellow promotes self-reliance and a need for an orderly life
This yellow increases our sensitivity to criticism

variations.name: Citrine Yellow
description: Citrine is a superficial and fickle color
It encourages the serial relationship hopper, the teaser, with unstable emotions
This yellow can be deceitful and retreats from responsibility

variations.name: Golden Yellow
description: This yellow is the color of the loner with an intense curiosity and interest in investigating the finer details of its interests
Golden yellow is sensitive to criticism

variations.name: Cream
description: Cream, tinted with a hint of yellow, encourages new ideas
However, this very pale color can also indicate a lack of confidence and a need for reassurance

variations.name: Dark Yellow
description: The darker shades of yellow indicate an inclination toward depression and melancholy, lack of love and low self-worth
Dark yellow relates to the constant complainer and the cynic

positive: Kind and loyal with a high moral sense
Encourages 'social joining' of clubs and other groups

represents.label: Harmony And Balance
represents.description: Green is the great balancer of our mental, emotional and physical energies which is why there is so much green on our planet. Green is the heart centre of the body

represents.label: Growth
represents.description: As in nature, green leaves are an indication the plant is still growing

represents.label: Hope
represents.description: Green is the anticipation of things to come

effects.label: Rejuvenating
effects.description: The color green revitalizes us when we are physically, mentally or emotionally exhausted

effects.label: Nurturing
effects.description: Because of its link with the heart, green urges us to nurture others. Green is also nurturing to us - another reason why it is the most predominant colour on earth

effects.label: Dependable Agreeable And Diplomatic
effects.description: The color green helps us to see situations clearly from all sides

effects.label: Possessiveness
effects.description: Green is a color that encourages us to want to own things and people, to collect and possess. Green encourages materialism

effects.label: Envy
effects.description: 'Green with envy' is a common phrase and a negative reaction to the color green

variations.name: Pale Green
description: As the color of new growth on plants, it indicates immaturity, youthfulness and inexperience
It allows us to see things from a new perspective, to make a fresh start

variations.name: Emerald Green
description: This is an inspiring and uplifting color suggesting abundance and wealth in all its forms, from material wellbeing, to emotional wellbeing to creative ideas

variations.name: Jade Green
description: The color of trust and confidentiality, tact and diplomacy
Jade green indicates a generosity of spirit, giving without expecting anything in return
It increases worldly wisdom and understanding, assisting in the search for enlightenment

variations.name: Lime Green
description: Lime green inspires youthfulness, naivety and playfulness
It is liked the most by younger people
It creates a feeling of anticipation, and helps to clear the mind of negativity

variations.name: Dark Green
description: There is a degree of resentment in dark green
Often used by wealthy businessmen, ambitious and always striving for more wealth
Dark green signifies greed and selfish desire

variations.name: Aqua
description: Aqua calms the spirit, offering protection and healing for the emotions

variations.name: Olive Green
description: Although the traditional color for peace, 'offering an olive branch', the color olive suggests deceit and treachery, blaming others for its problems
However there is also a strength of character with it that can overcome adversity to develop an understanding and caring of the feelings of others

variations.name: Yellow Green
description: This color green suggests cowardice, conflict and fear

variations.name: Grass Green
description: Grass green is the color of money
It is self-confident and secure, natural and healthy, occurring in abundance in nature

represents.label: Peace And Calm
represents.description: Blue is often associated with calm and serenity

represents.label: Trust And Loyalty
represents.description: It symbolizes trust, loyalty and faithfulness

represents.label: Wisdom And Intelligence
represents.description: Blue represents intelligence, wisdom and the power of communication

effects.label: Calming
effects.description: Blue calms the mind and reduces stress

effects.label: Lowering Blood Pressure
effects.description: It can lower blood pressure and slow respiration

effects.label: Promotes Mental Clarity
effects.description: Blue promotes clarity of thought and creativity

effects.label: Can Feel Cold
effects.description: Too much blue may feel cold or depressing

variations.name: Sky Blue
description: Sky blue suggests freedom, imagination and inspiration
It is uplifting and serene

variations.name: Navy Blue
description: Navy blue is strong and reliable
It denotes authority and trust

variations.name: Royal Blue
description: Royal blue conveys richness and importance
It is elegant and sophisticated

variations.name: Powder Blue
description: Powder blue is gentle and calming
It can evoke nostalgia and softness

represents.label: Intuition And Perception
represents.description: Indigo is linked to intuition and deep perception

represents.label: Wisdom And Spirituality
represents.description: It represents spiritual awareness and wisdom

represents.label: Seriousness And Mystery
represents.description: Indigo conveys seriousness, mystery and integrity

effects.label: Promotes Intuition
effects.description: Indigo encourages inner reflection and intuition

effects.label: Stimulates Spiritual Growth
effects.description: It supports spiritual growth and meditation

effects.label: Can Feel Intense
effects.description: The color can feel intense or overwhelming in excess

variations.name: Dark Indigo
description: Dark indigo suggests depth and sophistication
It is mysterious and powerful

variations.name: Indigo Blue
description: Indigo blue combines calm blue with mystical purple
It is thoughtful and introspective

represents.label: Inspiration
represents.description: Original and sound ideas are created with violet - use it when looking for inspiration during brainstorming sessions.

represents.label: Imagination
represents.description: Violet inspires creativity with intellect and stimulates dream activity.

represents.label: Individuality
represents.description: Violet is unconventional, individual and original. It hates to copy anyone else and likes to do its own thing.

represents.label: Spirituality
represents.description: Violet assists us during prayer and meditation, helping us to get in touch with our deeper subconscious thoughts.

effects.label: Empathy
effects.description: Compassion, kindness and a love of humanity are positive qualities of Violet.

effects.label: Controlled Emotion
effects.description: Violet is passionate, like red, but inclined to display it in private only.

effects.label: Respectable & Distinguished
effects.description: The darker shades of violet are linked to royalty and wealth.

effects.label: Impractical
effects.description: Violet can be impractical, tending to see life as imagined rather than reality.

effects.label: Immature
effects.description: Violet can encourage fantasy and idealism that are hard to achieve.

effects.label: Dignity
effects.description: Violet exudes a quiet modest dignity appealing to others.

effects.label: Cynical
effects.description: Violet can show a negative cynical side.

variations.name: Lavender
description: Lavendar suggests an attraction to the beautiful things
It conveys fragility, sensitivity, and vulnerability

variations.name: Lilac
description: Lilac implies immaturity, superficiality, youthfulness, extroverted, and enthusiastic.
It inspires glamour, romance, and vanity.

variations.name: Mauve
description: Mauve promotes the best choices and decisions; a colour concerned for justice
It may also convey a degree of commonness and social aspiring to higher ideals

variations.name: Amethyst
description: Amethyst opens itself to intuitive channels, a color of the evolved soul
Protects the vulnerable and assists the humanitarian

variations.name: Plum
description: Plum is honourable and linked to family traditions
To some, it can be prudish and narrow-minded

variations.name: Deep Purple
description: Dark purple relates to higher spiritual attainment
Powerful, can indicate arrogance and ruthlessness

represents.label: Communication
represents.description: Turquoise represents open communication from and between the heart and the spoken word. It relates to the electronic age, the world of computers, and large-scale communication.

represents.label: Emotional Control
represents.description: Being the mid-color between the extremes of red and violet, turquoise symbolizes balance for emotions, thoughts, and speech.

represents.label: Self-Sufficiency
represents.description: Turquoise tunes into its own needs and finds the way to success.

effects.label: Clarity of Thought
effects.description: Enhances focus and concentration, assists with clear thinking, decision-making, and developing good organizational skills.

effects.label: Calming
effects.description: Calming yet invigorating, restores depleted energies.

effects.label: Non-Emotional
effects.description: Can cause aloofness and hiding of emotional reactions.

variations.name: Aquamarine
description: Aquamarine enhances creativity and inspiration
It calms and balances the mind and emotions

variations.name: Aqua
description: Aqua is refreshing and uplifting
It is creative and light-hearted, yet strong and individual

variations.name: Teal
description: Teal signifies trustworthiness and reliability
It promotes spiritual advancement and commitment

represents.label: Unconditional Love
represents.description: Pink relates to both unconditional love and romantic love.

represents.label: Compassion
represents.description: Empathy and understanding are the fuel for pink's nurturing.

represents.label: Nurturing
represents.description: Pink is both the giving and the receiving of love, understanding and respect.

represents.label: Hope
represents.description: Pink inspires the possibility of a positive outcome.

effects.label: Calming
effects.description: Pink calms our emotional energies.

effects.label: Non-Threatening
effects.description: Pink lacks any aggression or anger, although the deeper pinks can be more assertive and confident.

effects.label: Affectionate
effects.description: Pink offers warmth and tenderness to friends and family.

effects.label: Caring
effects.description: Sensitivity and tender loving care relate to pink's feminine and intuitive energies.

effects.label: Immature
effects.description: Pink is the color of the sweet young girl, before life's experiences take over.

variations.name: Blush
description: Blush is similar to skin color and has sensual and sexual connotations.
It is non-threatening but lacks passion and energy.

variations.name: Salmon Pink
description: Salmon pink has a touch of orange.
It encourages the flirt and can be a sign of the timid lover, all talk and no play.

variations.name: Baby Pink
description: Baby pink is soft and gentle
It suggests innocence and sweetness

variations.name: Hot Pink
description: Hot pink is vibrant and energetic
It conveys passion and playfulness

variations.name: Rose
description: Rose is romantic and elegant
It evokes maturity, femininity, and intuition

represents.label: Universal Harmony
represents.description: At its highest level, magenta generates love, caring, kindness and cooperation, encouraging a balanced and harmonious outlook on life.

represents.label: Non-Conformist
represents.description: Magenta is the color of the free spirit—it does not like to be confined and contained.

represents.label: Change and Transformation
represents.description: Magenta helps to release old and outdated patterns of behavior to inspire growth and personal development.

effects.label: Emotional Balance
effects.description: Spiritual yet practical, it helps to create emotional, physical and spiritual balance.

effects.label: Compassion
effects.description: Gentle and caring in its approach, magenta generates acceptance, tolerance, support and patience.

effects.label: Inspiration
effects.description: Magenta inspires cheerfulness and optimism, creativity and innovation, dream activity, positive change and negotiating skills.

variations.name: Fuchsia
description: Fuchsia is bright and bold
It conveys confidence, assurance, and maturity

variations.name: Orchid
description: Orchid is soft and elegant, yet unconventional
It suggests charm and mystery - a non-conformist

represents.label: Stability
represents.description: Reassuring and comforting, earthy and contained.

represents.label: Structure
represents.description: It encourages orderliness and organization.

represents.label: Security
represents.description: Safe and protective — a refuge from the chaos of the outside world and a sense of belonging.

represents.label: Natural and Wholesome
represents.description: Related to the earth, nutrition, health and goodness.

effects.label: Comforting
effects.description: Sensual and warm, friendly and approachable, brown engulfs one in a feeling of calm and safety.

effects.label: Protective
effects.description: Creates a safe haven of support for family and friends.

effects.label: Materialistic
effects.description: Brown encourages material security and the accumulation of possessions.

variations.name: Light Brown
description: Light brown is friendly and approachable
It is sincere, honest, and genuine

variations.name: Dark Brown
description: Dark brown is strong yet sad and depressive
It is materialistic yet prudent

variations.name: Ivory
description: Ivory is calming, yet encouraging
It has a reserved style of simple sophistication

variations.name: Beige
description: Beige is practical and reliable
It is conservative, constant, unchanging, and loyal

variations.name: Tan
description: Tan is light and natural
It suggests simplicity and calmness

variations.name: Chocolate
description: Chocolate is rich and warm
It evokes comfort and security

variations.name: Umber
description: Umber is dark and earthy
It suggests strength and reliability

represents.label: Neutrality
represents.description: Gray is impartial and dispassionate; it doesn't take sides.

represents.label: Compromise
represents.description: Gray is the transition between two non-colors, neither black nor white. It takes the middle ground, neither one way nor the other.

represents.label: Control
represents.description: Gray is reserved, quiet and conservative. It has a steadying effect on other colors around it.

effects.label: Indecision
effects.description: Gray prefers to sit in the middle, not making a decision either way, sitting on the fence.

effects.label: Detached
effects.description: Being non-emotional, gray can appear indifferent, uncaring, cold and aloof.

effects.label: Depression
effects.description: Gray can stifle and depress energy, but it is also the stable base from which the new and positive can come.

effects.label: Unemotional
effects.description: Gray can appear neutral, disinterested, objective or impartial.

variations.name: Light Gray
description: Light gray is soft and neutral
It suggests calmness and balance

variations.name: Slate Gray
description: Slate gray is strong and serious
It evokes professionalism and formality

variations.name: Charcoal Gray
description: Charcoal gray is deep and sophisticated
It suggests power and elegance

represents.label: Mystery
represents.description: Black is the unknown. It is secretive, keeping a lot buried inside, unwilling to show its real feelings.

represents.label: Power and Control
represents.description: Black is power and control of the self and others. It creates fear and intimidation.

effects.label: Formal, Dignified and Sophisticated
effects.description: As in the little black dress and the formal dinner suit, black represents elegance and refinement.

effects.label: Aloof
effects.description: Black sets itself aside from others with its heavy and intense energy. It keeps others at arm's length.

effects.label: Depressing
effects.description: Black can close us to the positive aspects of life, forcing us to look at our disappointments and the negative aspects of life. It can create a fear of the future.

effects.label: Pessimistic
effects.description: Too much black encourages us to focus on the negative side of life.

variations.name: Jet Black
description: Jet black is pure and intense
It suggests strength and formality

variations.name: Charcoal Black
description: Charcoal black is softer and muted
It conveys seriousness and depth

represents.label: Innocence and Purity
represents.description: White is the beginning of everything, before anything is muddied or thinking is 'colored'.

represents.label: New Beginnings
represents.description: White represents the clean slate, helping us through times of stress, and allowing us to put the past behind us and prepare to move on.

represents.label: Equality and Unity
represents.description: White represents the positive as well as the negative aspects of all colors. It contains an equal balance of all the colors of the spectrum.

effects.label: Impartial
effects.description: White suggests fairness and neutrality because of the balance and equality of all the colors contained within it.

effects.label: Rescuer
effects.description: White rescues us from the dark. It is the white knight, rescuing the damsel in distress.

effects.label: Futuristic
effects.description: Symbolizing a clean slate, we can envisage anything with white.

effects.label: Efficient
effects.description: White is clean and clinical, giving an impression of efficiency and organization.

represents.label: Illumination
represents.description: Silver opens the mind and lights the way forward.

represents.label: Reflection
represents.description: It reflects back the energy sent out, whether that energy is positive or negative.

represents.label: Prestige and Wealth
represents.description: Silver is seen as glamorous and sophisticated, and relates to the professional and corporate market.

represents.label: Feminine Power
represents.description: Silver is related to the femininity of the moon's energy, sensitive, emotional and fluid.

effects.label: Calming and Soothing
effects.description: Its gentle and comforting qualities relate to the sensitivity of the moon's cycle of ebb and flow.

effects.label: Lifeless
effects.description: The colorless energy of silver can lead to negative feelings of coldness, indecision and being non-committal.

effects.label: Dignified and Responsible
effects.description: Silver is respectable and courteous, mature and determined, wise and organized.

variations.name: Light Silver
description: Light silver is bright and reflective
It suggests clarity and innovation

variations.name: Dark Silver
description: Dark silver is rich and elegant
It conveys sophistication and depth

represents.label: Success
represents.description: Gold relates to achievement and victory, the winner.

represents.label: Wealth
represents.description: Gold implies affluence, material wealth and extravagance.

represents.label: Prestige & Luxury
represents.description: Gold is associated with sophistication, elegance, value, quality and status.

effects.label: Enlightenment
effects.description: Gold, at its highest level, inspires knowledge, spirituality and a deep understanding of the self and the soul.

effects.label: Compassion
effects.description: Caring, loving, generous and giving, gold is the benefactor or patron.

effects.label: Generosity
effects.description: Gold loves to share its wisdom, knowledge and wealth with others.

variations.name: Light Gold
description: Light gold is bright and radiant
It suggests positivity and wealth

variations.name: Dark Gold
description: Dark gold is deep and rich
It conveys luxury and sophistication
